Description: Glazed composition shallow bowl; linear decoration in black paint, dots on rim top and framed vertical lines on rim interior; interior design consists an object resembling a lyre, a latticed enclosed shape and possibly part of a papyrus plant; traces of greenish blue glaze preserved only on exterior; repaired from fragments and extensively restored, part of rim missing; reddish brown core.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Bibliographic references: Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 201)
Peltenburg 1972 / On the Classification of Faience Vases from Late Bronze Age Cyprus. (P. 158)
Peltenburg 1986 / Ramesside Egypt and Cyprus (P. 158, No.2)
